definition: Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
same as Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], a mythical emperor/surname Xi
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: Li Shimin regarded Wang's calligraphy work as perfect.
sentences.chinese: 李世民對王羲之書法認爲已經達到了“盡善盡美”。

sentences.english: The author was Wang Xizhi, a calligrapher in Jin Dynasty in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 作者王羲之，中國古代晉代書法家。

sentences.english: One evening while he was in bed sleeping, his hand was tracing characters in the air.
sentences.chinese: 有一天晚上，王羲之上牀睡覺了，還在用手懸空寫字。

sentences.english: The authentic copies of Wang Hsi-chih's calligraphy are no longer available now.
sentences.chinese: 王羲之已經沒有真跡傳世了，現在傳世的都是鉤填本。

sentences.english: TangTai-zong admired Wang's calligraphy very much which consolidated the Wang's respectable position in the calligraphy field.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗推崇王羲之書法，從而奠定了王書的獨尊地位。
王羲之高超的書法水平。

sentences.english: Portrait of Wang Xizhi, the great Jin calligrapher, famed for his semi-cursive writing.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲最擅長寫行書的晉代大書法家王羲之。

sentences.english: Wang Xizhi was a famous calligrapher in china.
sentences.chinese: 王羲之是中國著名的書法家。

definition: Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Chu Suiliang (596-659), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Zhong Yao (151-230), minister of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4] and noted calligrapher, said to have developed the regular script 楷書|楷书[kai3 shu1]
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Yu Shinan (558-638), politician of Sui and early Tang periods, poet and calligrapher, one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
grass script/cursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
extant work of a calligrapher
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Zhu Yunming (1460-1526), Ming dynasty calligrapher
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
